CN.content:
Please identify the "Material Name" entities in the following paragraph. Please present the valid entities as a Markdown table with one column "Material Name". Make sure to present the entities precisely in the same words as in the original paragraph.

Paragraph: 37 In addition , all polymers showed broader absorption in thin films compared to in solution due to stronger interchain aggregation.

Let's think step by step.

| Material Name |
| --- |
| polymers |
| thin films |
| solution |

In this paragraph, the "Material Name" entities refer to "polymers," "thin films," and "solution." These terms are mentioned as the subjects of the study, and their properties and behaviors are discussed.

Please remove entities that do not clearly refer to "Material name" and present the valid entities as a Markdown table with one column "Material Name".

Make sure to present the entities precisely in the same words as in the original paragraph.

| Material Name |
| --- |
| polymers |

After re-evaluating the paragraph, I realized that only "polymers" clearly refer to a "Material Name." The other entities, "thin films" and "solution," are states of matter or forms of the material, not the material itself. Therefore, only "polymers" are presented in the table below.

| Material Name |
| --- |
| polymers |

PN.content:
Please identify the "Property Name" entities in the following paragraph. Please present the valid entities as a Markdown table with one column "Property Name". Make sure to present the entities precisely in the same words as in the original paragraph.

Paragraph: 37 In addition , all polymers showed broader absorption in thin films compared to in solution due to stronger interchain aggregation.

Let's think step by step.

| Property Name |
| --- |
| broader absorption |
| stronger interchain aggregation |

Please remove entities that do not clearly refer to "Material property" and present the valid entities as a Markdown table with one column "Property Name".

Make sure to present the entities precisely in the same words as in the original paragraph.

| Property Name |
| --- |
| broader absorption |
| stronger interchain aggregation |

The entity "broader absorption" is a material property as it refers to the range of wavelengths that a material can absorb. Similarly, "stronger interchain aggregation" is also a material property, as it refers to the degree of interaction between polymer chains in a material.
